intro: Galium verum f. latifolium, commonly known as yellow bedstraw, is a variant of the common bedstraw species. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The leaves are typically narrow and opposite, with a distinctive waxy coating. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it identifiable within the Rubiaceae family.
